questions.question_text: Which statement accurately describes the characteristics of an alert notification?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correcting myself just picked wrong answer its D based on my comment.

Selected Answer: C
You can create a lot of outbound plug-in instances:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.core.doc/GUID-230B9142-C290-4659-9CA5-F7CC152A4FE1.html

Selected Answer: D
You can create an outbound plugin to send alert notification to external systems such as service now, slack etc

choices.B: A SMTP Management pack is required to enable email notifications.
choices.C: Notifications are configured as part of an alert's symptom definition.
choices.D: vRealize Operations can be connected to the external alert notification system by configuring an outbound alert plug-in.
choices.A: Notifications are configured out-of-the-box but need to be explicitly enabled for each object discovered by vRealize Operations.

questions.question_text: Which actions can be performed on vSphere virtual machine from vRealize Operations Product UI? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCF
Based on documentation its BCF
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.config.doc/GUID-70DF9D94-3B43-4588-A77E-5D8501293F51.html
from the actions on version 6.8 we can delete unused Snapshoot , Move VM ADD VCPU so the answer would be B,C,F

Selected Answer: CD
C. Synchronize the User Groups: This ensures that the newly added users in the Active Directory group are synchronized with vRealize Operations.

D. Check if Automatically synchronize user membership for configured groups is selected: This setting ensures that user memberships are automatically synchronized, which helps in keeping the user accounts up-to-date.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is importing an Active Directory group with a role, and group members can login into vRealize Operations successfully. After a while, the administrator adds some new users into Active Directory group and discovers that newly added group members are not seen under User Accounts section and cannot login into vRealize Operations. Everything is working as expected for the old group members.

The administrator needs to take further steps to allow the newly added group members to login quickly into vRealize Operations.

Which two steps should the administrator take? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Add a SAML IdP as Authentication Source, and select source type as SSO SAML.
choices.D: Check if Automatically synchronize user membership for configured groups is selected.

questions.question_text: When should the advanced sizing guide be used instead of the basic sizing guide in the vRealize Operations Manager (vROps) online Sizing tool?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. When vROps High Availability or Continuous Availability features are going to be enabled

choices.D: When the vROps analytics nodes will be distributed across more than one physical data center
choices.C: When additional management packs are going to be implemented
choices.A: When vROps High Availability or Continuous Availability features are going to be enabled
choices.B: When the monitored environment will have more than 16 vSphere clusters
